newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish 10-yr bond price seen down in light demand.
newsitem.headline: Polish 10-yr bond price seen down in light demand.

text.p: The Minimum price of Poland's 10-year floating rate bond is expected to ease slightly at Tuesday's 600 million zloty primary auction amid small interest from investors, dealers said.
"Bids should total about a third of the Treasury's offer with minimum and average prices inching down by several basis points on Tuesday," said one foreign bank dealer in Warsaw.
At the last auction of similar 10-year bonds on January 10 the minimum price was 98.51 and the average price was 98.6. @

Dealers said the 10-year paper, whose coupon is based on the 52-week T-bill plus an interest margin, was not attractive for many investors despite its coupon because it was not liquid in secondary trade.
The value date for Tuesday's tender is March 19, 1997 and the paper is due on April 18, 2007.
